metadata.title: New Pre-pandemic Influenza Vaccines: An Egg-and Adjuvant- independent Human Adenoviral Vector Strategy Induces Long- lasting Protective Immune Responses in Mice

abstract.original_text: Highly pathogenic avian H5N1 influenza viruses that are currently circulating in southeast Asia may acquire the potential to cause the next influenza pandemic. A number of alternate approaches are being pursued to generate cross-protective, dose-sparing, safe, and effective vaccines, as traditional vaccine approaches, i.e., embryonated egg-grown, are not immunogenic. We developed a replicationincompetent adenoviral vector-based, adjuvant-and egg-independent pandemic influenza vaccine strategy as a potential alternative to conventional egg-derived vaccines.
